column4: Hello, I have downloaded yesterday the ubuntu cd from the website and when booting from it I notest that it does not detect my hdd and my wlan card, actually the wlan card does but thats another story, the main problem is the hdd because I cannot install the operating system from the bootcd, I am running on a brand new Dell Inspiron 1501 with a 80 GB SATA HDD
what do you mean by it doesn't detect your hdd?
exactly what I am saying, it is a SATA disk and I do have /dev/hda but when looking at the /var/log/messages log I saw that he tried to mount the drive about 5 times then gave up
I'm using SATA HD with no problems on Gentoo, so I assume that your installation CD doesn't have the drivers. Maybe you should try with the installation DVD.

I do not want to sound ignorant but I am not of a ubuntu user, myself I am more than a debian user but I did not see on the ubuntu website the option to download a dvd, as far as I can see there is only a cd version

There are definitely drivers for SATA under linux, but it may be possible that the installation CD you are using doesn't have them, maybe because it's to old, or too small, or whatever. For example with the Ubuntu installation CD you cannot install reiserfs, but with the Installation DVD you can.
Give me a minut and I'll give you a link.
I'm also not a real Ubuntu expert my self, I have been more into Gentoo for the last years.
Do you want it for Desktop or for server?
http://kubuntu.org/download.php
There you can download the DVD, it's Kubuntu, are you a GNOME user?

but I just want to test this distro more carefully because I saw there is much fuss about it

But starting with the installation disks, I think Kubuntu did a better job, but it's just my humble opinion.
yeah, I prefer kde, but anyway, thank you for all the help
